"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, I will analyze each section to identify any relevant information about efferents. The first document discusses hippocampal efferents reaching widespread areas of cerebral cortex and amygdala in rhesus monkeys. The second document explores the efferent connections of transplanted fetal SCN (suprachiasmatic nucleus) grafts using Dil. Although labelled efferents were observed in a majority of the grafts, most were confined to the limits of the graft and did not extend very far regardless of whether the graft contained immunohistochemical evidence for donor SCN or not.

The third document examines the areal and laminar distribution of some pulvinar cortical efferents in rhesus monkeys. It does not provide information about Leksell efferents.

The fourth document studies the efferent projections of the anterior hypothalamic area (AHA) using tritiated amino acid autoradiography. The axons from AHA neurons were not confined to local projections in the hypothalamus, but rather distributed to various regions including the dorsomedial, ventromedial, arcuate and dorsal premammillary nuclei, and to the median eminence.
